text: Loved it! Where did we end up?
I feel so good about the energy that was in the room yesterday.
Very excited about this opp for us
They have some immediate and longer term deck needs.
Great energy.
I think we need to find a balance between short and long term and use that to inform web, retail,  broader relationship goals.
<@U06DFL7BP>: added you to the email thread.
I think a blurb about what we discussed before we left last night along with any fresh morning thoughts delivered as an email would be a next step.
Could you run point on that this am?

Yup, and from our discussion last night because I was admittedly beat:
1. In the short term, take a quick pass at their existing deck, maybe do some cleanup of spreadsheet slide, graphs, etc. but not spend more than a couple of days on it, no format or creative direction changes
2. Begin mapping out the story to tell, capturing the pieces we discussed last night, talking to taralyn about creative direction, and in parllael work to get them a wireframe / story map... also next week? <@U1A1A9L7N>? 
3. Will regroup with <@U167FL70V> and <@U026PHQ3J> on the laundry list of website needs, see what we want to actually tackle and some semblance of scope
anything i'm missing?

My plan for the day…post up their deck and review/audit what can be done. Charles, if you have time, I’d appreciate your perspective of review/audit also…we can talk through things together. Once we assess we can map out the timeline. I also need to spend time today just taking things in and letting my brain marinate in their content.
sounds good to me, if there’s any way we can get a copy of that analysis they did on their architecture before having further convos it’d be super helpful
beyond the doc they shared?
yeah yesterday they said one of the devs they work with had done a thorough analysis of the architecture and made recommendations for how it could be improved
ah, k, i'll ask in my response as well
coo thx :slightly_smiling_face: even if we don’t take on the task of improving/rearchitecting it will give a lot of insight into what we would be working with
oh right. Travis? and the magento optimizations
oh wait i think it was someone from new relic they mentioned
don’t remember his name though
They're using retailops for ERP, too
<https://www.retailops.com/>

attachments.title: All-In-One Warehouse and order management software | RetailOps
attachments.text: RetailOps is a complete all-in-one retail WMS software package. Grow your business to new heights with tools catered to your business. Schedule a demo today!
attachments.fallback: All-In-One Warehouse and order management software | RetailOps

text: Marce, thanks for having me there yesterday! Definitely would love to be part of next brick and mortar store build outs. It's a bit of a long shot cause we don't have a 'team' at present but I'm super confident that we can pull it off creating what we need when needed :)
